In the context of machine learning, which of the following algorithms is most suitable for handling both linear and non-linear data, and is often used for classification and regression problems?
A. Linear Regression
B. Decision Trees
C. Support Vector Machines
D. K-Means Clustering

Support Vector Machines (SVM) are particularly well-suited for handling both linear and non-linear data in classification and regression problems. SVMs can effectively model complex decision boundaries by using kernel functions, which allow them to capture non-linear relationships in the data. This flexibility makes SVMs a powerful choice for a variety of machine learning tasks where the relationship between features and targets may not be strictly linear.
